Reviews.Title: “Premium service, food and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Btorp
Reviews.Content: Hotel in the East part of Berlin. Rooms are large and very clean. Breakfast very good, despite 3 mornings could not test all in the included buffet breakfast, fresh, nice and tasty. Also nice restaurant. Public transport close, take not many minutes to get to Alexanderplatz. Also a small shopping mall with fast food, coffe shops, bottle stores etc. nearby. Good parking and easy access. Friendly and helpful staff, no problem with English. Nice hotel, but not central.

Reviews.Title: “It's great”
Reviews.Author: FLesleyP
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel - OK it's in the former East so bit far out, but transportation simple and efficient - UBahn 5 - Tierpark stop - is short stroll and goes to Alexanderplatz, and tram M17 across the road. There's a big Kaiser's (food, drink, baker's, coffee to go) supermarket and even a McDonald's near the UBahn stop. Breakfast buffet extensive and good, packing up at 9.50 for 10. We found staff helpful and friendly though maybe does help that I speak German? Room (ours on 8th floor) airy and spacious - as most German hotels (why?) no coffee-making materials. From airport to hotel: take S9 to Frankfurter Allee, walk to end of platform take lift to street, then walk a little and turn right, across to other lift in UBahn station then down to platform to U5 to Tierpark. Takes longer to describe than do! Getting a travel card in the airport for 24/48/72 hours makes it all so easy.

Reviews.Title: “not a four star”
Reviews.Author: mrrocko69
Reviews.Content: stayed four nights in sept. i did not find the staff very helpful in giving directions or helping with the room. room was basic. i had a single very small bed no A/C but had a large window that opened. Maid and min bar just came in room without knocking. large breakfast buffet if you like cold eggs and hot dogs. lunch meat was good. it took over 1 hour to get from airport to hotel i took the bus fro airport to the underground then another 20min ride to tierpark. there is a sign saying what exit to take but after that you have to guess which way to go. if you have large suitcase you do not want to go in the wrong direction. finally asked someone and he looked it up on his phone and pointed me in the right direction about 400m from exit. I did not like this hotel because if weather is bad walking to metro is long andcold andwet i would pay a little more and get a more central location next time

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Shirley M
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel, situated 200 metres from tube (Ubahn) station, with direct access to central Berlin in about 20 minutes. Big, clean, comfortable room, very quiet. Nice bathroom, everything worked. Comfortable bed. Staff couldn't do enough for us, and they all seemed to have very good English. Stayed here with two friends for four nights in order to 'see' Berlin. Buffet breakfast with good selection of hot and cold food. Pleasant restaurant for dinner in the evening, which was a changing buffet. There is a little 'eaterie' just around the corner if you get buffet-boredom. Tea and coffee on tap in the bistro/bar at all hours of day and night. We had to wait until 7 p.m. for the taxi to pick us up for the airport coming home, and at no time did we feel the staff wanted to push us out. Yes, we loved the Tierpark - very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: EimearT
Reviews.Content: I stay in Berlin alot for work, and choose this for proxinity to a meeting. Although this is a good basic hotel, for the same money, alot more central accomodation would offer better value in the city. Everything cost extra and no free wifi. On the plus, staff are nice and very helpful, the rooms, although dated are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to explore Berlin but not during a hot summer.”
Reviews.Author: CeesTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the first week of July. The hotel is situated in a poor looking area of the former eastern part of Berlin. It’s about 5 minutes walk to the metro station and from there it’s about 15 minutes by metro to the Alexanderplatz. From there you can explore the whole (big) city. A great advantage of this hotel is the fact they offer free parking and you don’t need an Umweltplakette for your car. The hotel itself looks quite modern, as you can expect from a 4 star hotel. We booked our room for 48,00 Euro per night with breakfast included. For a 4 star hotel in Berlin this is an unbeatable price. They have very large rooms and normal rooms. Off course for this price we got a normal room but it was at least as large as a room you get in a luxury hotel in the centre of Berlin. So our room was very comfortable with two large beds, a big cupboard, a large working desk, a flat screen TV and a comfortable bathroom. The only downside of the room and the bathroom was the missing of any mechanical ventilation. This is very poor for a 4 star hotel. The only way to get some ventilation in the bathroom is to open a window. We also missed air-conditioning. When we were there temperatures were very cool but during a hot period the room would be much too warm without mechanical ventilation and any air-conditioning. Breakfast was impressive compared to the price we paid. A large buffet wit fresh eggs, omelets, a lot of fresh fruits, yoghurts and much more. Because it’s a large hotel the breakfast area most of the time was very crowded and noisy. They also serve dinner in this area but it’s not a place for us to have a relaxed dinner after a long day in Berlin. The hotel does not offer free WIFI which was a bad point for us. We think in 2011 every hotel should offer free WIFI at least in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Staff, Big Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cbcGlos Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel the night before, chose it for its easy transport connections, large room size and hearty breakfast. All of which were clear to see upon our arrival. Breakfast has a wide selection of hot and cold foods, as well as choices of coffee's and teas. The restaurant in the evening is also lovely. Only 200m from the Tube, with a 16min connection to Alexanderplatz. The trains are safe and Berlin itself is the friendliest city I have visited. There is a supermarket and small shopping centre mcdonalds very close by. The only downside is that the double beds are two singles pushed together. However this is the same for the majority of hotels in Berlin. Staff were very helpful with directions to places and also booked us into a restaurant. Would stay again, but its a big world out there so it may not be for a while yet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and basic”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice189
Reviews.Content: Situated in a residental area of Berlin, the Abacus is a basic hotel whose main attraction is value for money. Good transportation facilities closeby: U-bahn a few minutes away and the tramway is literally across the street. Stores for most needs only 5" on foot. Bathrooms are a bit short on amenities as the only thing provided - shower gel/shampoo dispenser in the shower and a nail file. Thus no soap for the sink and additionally, no wash cloths. (although many European hotels do not provide them). Genial, helpful reception staff, and most speak English. I cannot comment on the spa or the wellness center as I did not use the facilities nor did I eat any meals at the hotel. Disappointed that the they charged extra for Internet service and that both the maid service and mini-bar personnel entered the room after knocking just twice. This was very annoying the first time it happened for I had just gotten out of the shower and could not get to the door to tell them not to come in. At the time of my visit, there were no 'do not disturb' signs to put on the door. During the course of my stay I was loged in two different rooms (left Berlin mid-trip to travel to another city then returned at the end of the trip) In both rooms, the shower did not drain well nor did the sink drain (efficiently) in the second room. Personally I would not rate the Abacus as a 4-star hotel. There just aren't enough amenities and absolutely no 'luxury' to warrant that classification.

Reviews.Title: “DOES THE JOB BUT BAD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: Looks bleak from the outside but it's a good hotel. A bit off the map though and really not for the ordinary Berlin tourist. Clean, bright rooms with a LCD-tv with many international channels.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean and good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmrigueiro
Reviews.Content: I was informed a few days before my trip to Berlin, by the original hotel I booked a month ago, that they were fully booked and they booked me a room at Abacus. I was not very happy but gave a try anyway, I was not going to find any other accommodation in Berlin two days before my trip. The hotel is 15 minutes away by tube from Alexanderplatz, in a quiet, safe and residential area. The tube station is not even 5 minutes away walking from the hotel and for 2 days I got back very late to the hotel and did not have any problem. There is a street market in the area as well as a McDonalds, a Netto supermarket, pharmacy and some other shops. The staff is very friendly, although their English is not very good. They gave me a map of Berlin and also some information on all touristic places. I wanted to check in before 3pm and was told that I should pay a fee of €20, so I just left my suitcase in the luggage room which didn't cost me anything. The room was small but perfect and most importantly clean! I slept very well, it's quiet and nice! Breakfast was not included in my accommodation and a fee of €10 a day would be added to my bill if I wanted to have a breakfast there. I didn't even ask about dinner as I did one of the walking tours and the guide was so friendly that some of us hanged out with him for the following days and he took us to nice and cheap restaurants and we had good meals. There is a Starbucks at Alexanderplatz where I had my coffees, smoothies, cakes, etc for only €5. The day before my departure, I tried checking in online using the computer in the facilities room. €1.50 for 15 minutes and I didn't go anywhere as the internet was very slow. Well, that was not bad and for sure I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel choice for families”
Reviews.Author: brambling_10
Reviews.Content: My 9-year old son and I stayed here for a four nights and we can thoroughly recommend this hotel. Our room was large and spotlessly clean. Staff were friendly and courteous. Breakfast was buffet style and caters for everyone. The spa facilities were excellent and very welcome after a day out in Berlin. Tierpark zoo is a few steps away and surprisingly good (I normally don't like zoos). The neighbourhood is quiet but the hotel is very close to the Tierpark U-bahn station and only 20 minutes to Alexanderplatz. There is a large supermarket close to the station - useful. Finally, the restaurant between the U-bahn and hotel is pretty good! All in all I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “abacus tierpark awesome but no ac...”
Reviews.Author: JaygelynQ
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, it is near the subway and it is so accessible...there are also attractions near the area...but the rooms doesn't have AC...You have to ask them for a ventilator if you go there cause if not, they will not offer you...Go there during maybe winter or spring...it might have a difference cause we went there summer and its so hot...

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel if you're gonna be out a lot...”
Reviews.Author: devlicious
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, though the first room we got had not been cleaned much. After a call to the reception we were quickly moved to another room without hasstle. Good service on that part. Overall a good stay, waterpressure is good, beds comfy. U-Bahn connection right down the road, less then 2 minutes away. it 'll take you right to alexanderplatz in 10 minutes. Also within walking distance is a shopping centre with a supermarket that's open till midnight, aswell as a Mcdonalds. The only bad thing about the hotel was that the minibar person came right into the room at 9am not once, but 2 days in a row!? eventhough the "do not disturb" sign was on the door. Even complaints to the reception did not seem to work. Now i work in hotels myself, this should not happen! Also the wireless internet is not free, it's still t-mobile. a 4 star hotel should have it for free! it's 2009 people! Overall, nice hotel, close to the city, but without the noise of the city :D

Reviews.Title: “Stay at another hotel if possible...”
Reviews.Author: joeinsweden
Reviews.Content: PROS: Very nice sauna facility, large rooms, cheap mini-bar (1 Euro for beer), good communication with U5 underground CONS: a good 20-25 minutes to Alexanderplatz, EVERYTHING in the hotel is outlandishly priced (i.e. 14 Euro for breakfast, 8 Euro for WiFi), dingy, smelly and extremely outdated facility with no WiFi in half the rooms. NOT A REAL 4 STAR I think the only reason I'm not writing a super-damning review is because I got this hotel through Hotwire and therefor recieved a very good price on it. This place is not a 4 star- I am still amazed at how they were able to recieve such high classification. I think the max you can give this place is 3 stars. It's dingly, oudated by decades, lacking normal amenities you'd expect at a 4 star (like WiFi in your room), and is quite far from the culture, art, and party scenes of Berlin. The service is "ehh", you can expect the same or more at most other Berlin hotels. Before booking this hotel I highly recommend checking out other, much nicer (and cheaper) hotels closer to Alexanderplatz such as Best Western City Ost by Frankfurter Tor or Motel One on Alexanderplatz. They have lower star ratings but you can be sure that they will be nicer than the Abacus Tierpark.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price - nice location”
Reviews.Author: taznjo
Reviews.Content: We took a weekend get-away to Berlin and found this hotel online. Every hotel we tried to book was full- due to a huge reunification celebration that weekend, but ABACUS had rooms. I wasn't sure to expect - but was plesantly suprised. We booked through booking.com and it came to 159 euro for two nights for a double. The room was HUGE. The beds were not that comfortable, but I am kinda picky about beds. The bathroom was large with a big bathtub. The hotel was located about 30meters from a train station and for 6.10 euro you can get a pass and ride the trains all day - a good value. You can buy the train tickets at the front counter. There was lots of parking and the hotel is quite large. Some things I didn't like was that breakfast was an additional 14 euro p/person, so we bought some bread, meat and cheese at a NETTO for 3 euro and it was basically the same as what they served. Internet service cost 8 euro p/hour, so that was out. They have a few brochures but not many. The staff was curteous but didn't speak that much English, but then again we were in Germany. The hotel is in a run-down part of town it seemed, but you wouldn't tell from the inside, which was great. All in all, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: russ90210
Reviews.Content: We found our stay in Berlin to be alright thanks to the Abacus. Especially considering that Berlin is quite expensive to find a place, we were satisfied with our stay. If we found a similar hotel a bit closer in with the same price and same facilities (particularly if it was in the west), we might prefer it over the Abacus, but we would probably stay again. Not the best, not the worst, but middle of the road. Positives: + Close to the S-Bahn stop Tierpark (Hint: When arriving, be on the look out for the Abacus hotel signs as you get out from the tram - and follow the signs to that exit - and then walk towards the Tierpark Hotel sign - straight up for about 200 metres and then turn left). Because of this location - it really makes it easy to go to the main parts of Berlin from the Abacus. + Staff were quite helpful when we wanted to change rooms to have stronger Wifi connectivity. + Spacious room. The bathroom is quite good, you can put your bags down, spread out and be comfortable. Negatives: - Wifi internet not available in every room, and it's not free unlike a lot of other hotels in Europe. - We asked the staff if the area was safe - and while we had no problems walking in the light towards the S-Bahn station entry - we have heard that there was a robbery in the area recently - The hotel room itself is not the most pleasing to the eye in terms of decore. But when you're less than 5 minutes from the tram and then another 10~15 minutes from the action of Berlin, you don't really worry about the decore!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Tierpark”
Reviews.Author: MaverickRoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a 7 Day Contiki tour of Berlin and Prague over Christmas. Stayed in a Studio Room, which had two king single beds and a small rollaway bed. Very spacious room, with a nice entryway with a large wardrobe and storage area for luggage and clothes. Room also had a lovely lounge and sitting area, with a nice big desk. Service was lovely, on the first night I found the pillows a bit soft, we went down for breakfast and asked reception for another pillow, by the time we had come back from breakfast it was there. The restaurant is quite good, the buffet breakfast and dinners that we had were quite enjoyable, the quality of the food was good, although the offerings were a little interesting for us Australians. Would definately stay here again, although location wise its probably not what you would say in the centre of town, you would pay about 25EUR for a taxi from town or jump on the U-Bahn from Alexanderplatz and its about 10 stops. Ross...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at Tierpark”
Reviews.Author: lanakoala
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the Tierpark via a taxi. Found the hotel slightly dated but very spacious. My room was a quick walk from the reception which was a great treat. Unfortunately the lock on my room was worn so the key was very difficult to use. Upon entering I found the room pleasant. We had more than enough space to drop baggage and get organized. The bathroom was small but satisfactory. We also had a mini-bar (a treat), a tv, two phones and a desk area. Our room though cold at first proved to be very warm. Hence the duvet was fine. Other customers might not appreciate the sparse bed clothes or the very thin pillows. An extra pillow would have been much appreciated. As someone pampered by American hotels the only notable difference was the quality of the bed. I slept comfortably, but would have loved to have been in a proper bed. The bar was fine for hotel standards. I could order what I wished with little difficulty (and little German). The meals were very nice. The breakfast in particular provided a great variety of foods to select. I was very pleased with the selection and the dining space. The hotel was within close proximity to transport. There was a U station that would take us to Alexanderplatz on the U5 and then anywhere we wished to go from there. Overall pleasantly surprised by this hotel as it was not my decision but rather my tour company's decision to have us stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bazzaman1
Reviews.Content: we got the train from krakow to berlin after our flights were cancelled,so we had to stay a night in berlin before we flew back to dublin.we got a taxi from central station to the hotel which cost around 25 euro.we picked this hotel because it was in the same direction as schonfeld airport.the lobby are is nice..very spacious and comfortable.the rooms were very big..alot bigger than your average hotel room.it was clean and had sat tv.we aint in the restaurant that evening.it was buffet style...for about 15 or 16 euro you can eat as much as you like.it was an excellent meal,great selection and great value for money.we did not go to the bar as we were too tired.the breakfast the next morning was superb..met the standards of the dinner.not sure if there is leisure facilities in this hotel.the next morning we got a taxi to the airport..it cost about 20 euro or so.good hotel for the medium price range.i think there is good connections to the city centre via metro and bus nearby.i would recommend this hotel for its comfort and food!

Reviews.Title: “In The first room there were free silverfishes and a bad mattrass”
Reviews.Author: Knutsack
Reviews.Content: It was the weekend of the Berlin Marathon, so it was hard to get a room in Berlin. Sadly we booked this hotel for expensive 95 € a night. In our first room we had several silverfishes in the bathroom and one mattrass had springs to be feeled very easily which punished your back. So we wanted to leave after the first nicht, but the hotel didn´t want the refund the money for the second bight so we stayed there for that second night. We got a suite whch was good and clean and the mattrasses were ok. But it is not a courtoues behaviour of the hotel to remain on the second night.and not willing to cancel it. Also the hotel has no good looking facade. I do not know how it got 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in medium price range”
Reviews.Author: TravelnutsUk
Reviews.Content: The Abacus Tierpark is an above average hotel, used by many business travellers and was busy throughout our stay. The breakfast was excellent and plentiful with lots of choice for large and small appetites but the restaurant gets very busy at about 07:30 - 08:30 on weekdays and 08:30 - 09:30 at weekends. The staff were all extremely helpful and spoke excellent english in most cases when our German failed us. The hotel is only 100 metres from the Tierpark U-bahn 5 station which takes you direct to Alexander Platz in about 20 minutes. It is worth buying a day card for travel on U and S- bahns and buses for 5.80 Euros. These can either be purchased in the hotel or on the platform at the station but the tickets must be validated by stamping them in the machine provided at the station. The only downside to the Hotel is that the location in East Berlin is not close to any of the main sights of Berlin except the Tierpark but the trains are quick, plentiful (every 5 minutes on weekdays) and very efficient. Kurfurstendamm and Potsdammer Platz were both excellent for shopping and there were just too many wonderful buildings and other sights to pick out favourites (queues to get into some attractions can get very long during the afternoons, so we found it paid to get there early) but the river trips are a good way to see everything in a peaceful setting. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would recommend Berlin for a city break and would definitely stay at the Abacus Tierpark again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mother for a short citytrip (3 nights). This hotel is marvelous! It deserves at least 3 out of 5 stars (my travelguide said 3+ stars.) The room we stayed in was huge, it was about 35 squaremeters. The room included a writing desk with stationery, tv plus tv guide, minibar, shoepolish, a press for your pants, a little sewing-box, large closet. Our bathroom was also very roomy and had a bath. Breakfast was even better: it was served as a buffet, when entering the breakfastroom, waitresses asked if you would like to have coffee or tea (and which kind of tea.) After that, the real party started, we could choose from: baked/hardboiled/soft cooked/scrambled eggs, you can put together your own cereal, yoghurt, milk, chocolate milk, all kinds of fruit, 4 types of sausages, different sorts of bread and I even saw some people enjoying a champagne breakfast! Tube station at about 200 meters. We would definately go here again!
